title: The Name of the Rose 1986 BDRemux multi-HighCode
description:
The Name of the Rose 1986 BDRemux multi-HighCode

"Der Name der Rose" (original title)

Drama | Mystery | Thriller
 <a href="
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0091605/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0091605/</a>

An intellectually nonconformist monk investigates a series of mysterious deaths in an isolated abbey.

Source-------- EUR BD
Released------ 2013/11/06
Format-------- Matroska/AVC
File size----- 15.1 GB
Length-------- 2:11:35
Video Bit rate 19 MBps (15~25 MBps)
Resolution---- 1920/1080
Frame rate---- 23.976 fps
Audio--------- ENG DTS-5.1 @768 / DD-2.0 @192: Fre, Ger, Ita, Spa
Subtitles(ass) Eng, Ara, Cze, Dan, Dut, Fin, Fre, Ger, Gre, Hun, Ita, Nor,
               Pol, Pt br & eur, Rom, Rus, Spa eur & lat, Srp, Swe, Tur, Vie
Screens------- <a href=" http://imgbox.com/g/K7g3XM2ZGa" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://imgbox.com/g/K7g3XM2ZGa</a>
Remux by------ HighCode

I intended to upload the 1080p encode but it became way too big (12GB) and of course
with some loss of quality, so then I decided to upload the lossless video instead.

video quality, from blury.com:
"The Name of the Rose has never been a gorgeous film, partly due to design, and this new Blu-ray doesn't improve the film's inherent softness (especially in second unit outdoor and establishing shots) and grittiness. The good news is the film looks manifestly better and sharper than it did on DVD, especially once we get inside the monastery."

Sound, DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 track wasn't a bombastic, mind blowing track,
no extreme sound effects at all there so DTS @768 is just as fine, saving almost 3GB.
